summaryText: In this powerful Palm Sunday message, Pastor Travis Hearn delivers a compelling sermon about God's rescue mission through Jesus Christ. Drawing from John chapters 11 and 12, PT explores the incredible story of Lazarus's resurrection and the profound spiritual metaphor of being set free from our past bondages. Have you ever felt like you're stuck in a cycle of repeating the same mistakes, praying for God to get you out, but then returning to those very situations? Pastor Travis vulnerably shares his own experiences, like a risky desert party in his youth, to illustrate our human tendency to return to our 'vomit' - our old sinful patterns. But the good news? Jesus saves! The sermon's heartbeat is 'Hosanna' - meaning 'God saves' - reminding us that our salvation isn't based on our promises to God, but on His promises to us. Whether you're feeling trapped, late to the rescue, or bound by past mistakes, Pastor Travis powerfully declares that Jesus has the resurrection power to bring you back to life and set you free. The most incredible part? God's rescue mission isn't just about you - it's about the testimony of His glory that can impact others around you!
mainPoints: God can rescue you from any situation
Your testimony of God's work is powerful and threatens the enemy
Jesus saves, not based on our promises, but His

versesMentioned.text: I do not understand what I do. For what I want to do I do not do, but what I hate I do.
As a dog returns to its vomit, so fools repeat their folly.
Rejoice greatly, Daughter Zion! Shout, Daughter Jerusalem! See, your king comes to you, righteous and victorious, lowly and riding on a donkey, on a colt, the foal of a donkey.

When he had said this, Jesus called in a loud voice, 'Lazarus, come out!' The dead man came out, his hands and feet wrapped with strips of linen, and a cloth around his face. Jesus said to them, 'Take off the grave clothes and let him go.'
Whoever dwells in the shelter of the Most High will rest in the shadow of the Almighty. I will say of the Lord, 'He is my refuge and my fortress, my God, in whom I trust.'

Monday.scripture: 2 Corinthians 5:17: 'Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, the new creation has come: The old has gone, the new is here!'
Monday.focus: Recognizing your identity in Christ beyond past mistakes
Monday.action: Make a list of old habits or patterns you want to surrender. Pray over each one, symbolically 'unwrapping' those grave clothes.
Monday.prayer: Lord, help me see myself as You see me - new, redeemed, and free. Give me the courage to walk away from old patterns that no longer define me. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Galatians 5:1: 'It is for freedom that Christ has set us free. Stand firm, then, and do not let yourselves be burdened again by a yoke of slavery.'
Tuesday.action: Identify one area where you feel spiritually 'bound'. Journal about how God might be calling you to freedom.
Tuesday.prayer: God, reveal the areas where I'm still walking in bondage. Give me strength to break free and walk in the liberty You've provided. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Romans 8:1-2: 'Therefore, there is now no condemnation for those who are in Christ Jesus, because through Christ Jesus the law of the Spirit who gives life has set you free from the law of sin and death.'
Wednesday.action: Practice speaking affirmations of your identity in Christ. Replace negative self-talk with scriptural truths.
Wednesday.prayer: Father, help me walk in the freedom of Your grace. Remove shame and replace it with Your unconditional love. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Isaiah 43:18-19: 'Forget the former things; do not dwell on the past. See, I am doing a new thing! Now it springs up; do you not perceive it?'
Thursday.action: Write a letter to yourself from God's perspective, highlighting His vision for your future.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, help me trust Your process of renewal. Give me eyes to see the new things You're doing in my life. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Ephesians 4:22-24: 'You were taught, with regard to your former way of life, to put off your old self, which is being corrupted by its deceitful desires; to be made new in the attitude of your minds; and to put on the new self, created to be like God in true righteousness and holiness.'
Friday.action: Choose one practical way to 'put on' your new self today. Act intentionally different from your old patterns.
Friday.prayer: God, give me strength to actively choose transformation. Help me reflect Your character in my actions today. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: 1 Peter 1:13-16: 'Therefore, preparing your minds for action, and being sober-minded, set your hope fully on the grace that will be brought to you at the revelation of Jesus Christ. As obedient children, do not be conformed to the passions of your former ignorance, but as he who called you is holy, you also be holy in all your conduct.'
Saturday.action: Reflect on your week. Celebrate the areas where you've seen growth and surrender the areas still needing transformation.
Saturday.prayer: Lord, thank You for Your patient transformation. Continue Your work in me, making me more like Jesus each day. Amen.
